values.undefined: For beauty, it’s not enough to rely solely on artistry and taste. Treatments should be performed systematically. In this case, in addition to the aesthetic aspect, attention has been given to the treatment factors such as the length of the dental crown and the patient’s occlusal relationship.
values.title: A Blend Of Science And Art
values.description: Description: Achieving beauty in dentistry requires more than just artistry and taste; treatments should be performed systematically. In this case, attention has been given not only to the aesthetic aspects but also to functional factors such as the length of the dental crowns and the patient's occlusal relationship.

values.title: Minimal Treatments - Maximal Achievements
values.undefined: Some treatments, although they do not involve complex stages and are easily performed, have extensive achievements. In this case, an extraordinary achievement has been obtained by using only composite veneers on six teeth, greatly transforming the patient's smile.
values.description: Description: Some treatments, while not involving complex stages and being relatively easy to perform, yield significant results. In this case, an extraordinary transformation was achieved using only composite veneers on six teeth, greatly enhancing the patient's smile.

values.title: Restoring Your Teeth
values.brief: .Restorative treatments for tooth decay vary in complexity based on severity, including fillings with amalgam, composite, or ceramic resins, and may require procedures like root canals or implants for extensive damage

values.description1:
Restorative Treatments for Tooth Decay

Surely, you have experienced filling a tooth before. When teeth develop decay, they require restoration. Restoration is a process in which the damaged or decayed part of the tooth is removed and replaced with specialized filling materials, such as composites, that can function like natural tooth tissue. These materials must possess certain characteristics to be suitable for replacing tooth structure. Tooth decay can vary in severity. Initially, decay affects a small portion of the tooth, which, if left untreated, can spread. If the decay advances, it may necessitate more complex treatments beyond simple restorative procedures.

Each tooth has multiple surfaces and a volume, and decay typically affects a specific area on one side of the tooth. It is unnecessary to treat all surfaces; only the damaged portion needs restoration.

Various treatments may be recommended for tooth damage, which we will discuss further in this article.
values.description2:
Restorative Treatments for Tooth Decay

Restorative treatments for tooth decay can vary depending on the severity of the decay. If the decay is severe and reaches the root, a root canal treatment may be necessary. In some cases, if the damage is extensive, the tooth may need to be extracted and replaced with an implant. However, if the decay is in its early stages, it can be treated with restorative procedures using various materials.

Amalgam

Tooth restoration using amalgam is a direct method. Amalgam is a flexible and strong material, though it is not tooth-colored and usually appears silver or black. Amalgam has the highest durability among restorative materials and is less expensive than composites. Its composition includes silver, tin, nickel, and mercury. Due to mercury's toxicity, the use of amalgam has been prohibited in some countries like those in Scandinavia. This treatment has become obsolete due to the health risks associated with mercury exposure.

Composite

Tooth restoration using composite is also a direct method. Composites are resin-based and paste-like materials made from various fillers, and they come in different types depending on their application. The color of composite can match the rest of a person’s teeth and comes in various shades. You can consult with your dentist to determine which composite color is suitable for you. These materials have a natural appearance due to their tooth-like color. The lifespan of composites is shorter compared to other methods. Nowadays, ceramics are used as constituent materials in composites, increasing their durability and providing a more natural appearance. This treatment is the most popular and is considered the most appropriate method for tooth restoration. However, no treatment is completely definitive.

Ceramic Resins

In this method, an impression of the teeth is taken, and based on that impression, the laboratory creates replacement parts for the decaye portions of your teeth. If the inner part of the tooth is decayed and only the inner portion is filled with ceramic materials, it is called an inlay. If the decay is on the outer part of the tooth, it is called an onlay. This method is usually used for extensive restorations because it involves a larger portion of the tooth. These ceramic fillings match the color of the tooth and have a natural appearance.

These materials can be applied using two methods: direct and indirect. Direct methods are performed directly by the dentist, while indirect methods, such as those involving composite resins, are done using a laboratory. In the indirect method, an impression of your tooth is taken, sent to the laboratory, and the restoration is fabricated for you.

 

 

Signs of Tooth Decay:

Tooth decay and cavities present various symptoms, and we have listed the most common ones below. If you notice any changes in your teeth or gums, it is best to visit a dentist, as your teeth may be affected by decay.

Here are the symptoms of tooth decay:

  • Bad breath
  • Food getting stuck between teeth
  • Toothache when applying pressure
  • Change in tooth color to brown or black
  • Fractured dental floss in decayed areas
  • Chipping or breaking of a portion of the tooth
  • Sensitivity to hot and cold temperatures when chewing food

If you observe any of these signs, it is advisable to consult a dentist.
values.description3:
:Recurring Tooth Decay After Restoration

Many people believe that once they have undergone a dental restoration, there is no need for further care and attention to the restored tooth. However, this is a misconception. Dentists recommend that post-restoration care should be even more rigorous. The more consistent and meticulous these care practices are, the longer the lifespan of the materials used in the dental restoration. It is important to note that sugary foods and carbonated beverages contribute to the deterioration and recurrence of tooth decay. Additionally, smoking and alcohol exacerbate tooth decay.

You can get your teeth restored at any reputable dental clinic. However, it is advisable to undergo a thorough examination of your teeth first to assess their overall condition and choose the best treatment option. Dr. Abadian Dental Clinic is one of the best centers that provides comprehensive information to patients about the treatment process before performing any dental restorations. Patients receive necessary counseling from their dentist in a calm environment and start the treatment process fully informed
